tweets.text: Our staff have been working with @EnvAgencyMids and @BhamCityCouncil to renaturalise parts of the River Cole, adding curve, creating habitats & improving conditions for fish and invertebrate population movements. It‚Äôs part of our vision to improve the river for wildlife & people https://t.co/4xPmOEt3Aa

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes "Our rivers and bathing waters are in a much better state than 20 years ago".

Does someone actually read this stuff?

Let me remind you, in 2016 14% of rivers in England reached 'Good' overall environmental health. 

In 2019? Err? None!

Time to go.

https://t.co/8J3kNikmZL

We're holding a virtual public meeting to discuss our plans for new Bishopthorpe flood defences in York, 6.30pm on Wednesday 4 November.

Join us via  zoom  
ID: 812 6062 9756
Password: YorkC1

Ask any questions with Slido (code #YorkC1) before or during the event
#Flood #YorkFAS https://t.co/wOHlRkGkzH

Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O

"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly." 

My letter to @thetimes quoted in their article about cuts to UK regulators today. https://t.co/9qGJ8JzWBf

Full text üëá https://t.co/BNpdhz7Z8a

Lots of salmon attempting to get over Diglis Weir #worcester this afternoon.

24 attempts in 20 minutes. Only 1 succeeded.

Won‚Äôt be a problem next year when @SevernUnlocked fish pass is finished. https://t.co/Pj1RurSfqE

tweets.text: @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd EBH joined the board of the @EnvAgency in 2009. What has she done about it during the last 11 years? @BBCWomansHour

@Feargal_Sharkey @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour 2009 - Around when Operator Self Monitoring was introduced, the EA let go of any illusion of control and went downhill to its present tragic state of ineptitude and failure. I wonder how she writes that up on her CV.

@Feargal_Sharkey @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour If it‚Äôs true that government has underfunded @EnvAgency, @EmmaHowardBoyd and @JamesBevanEA should have been loudly holding HMG to account, and resigned on principle if their financial demands weren‚Äôt met.

@EmmaHowardBoyd @WCL_News @EnvAgency @thetimes The steady erosion of @EnvAgency funding thanks to @DefraGovUK failing to stand up to @hmtreasury has led to this failure. If the Spending Review doesn't deliver the goods, would the Agency Board be forced to consider their positions?

urls.title: Environmental breaches soar as prosecutions collapse
urls.description: There has been a sharp rise in serious breaches of environmental rules designed to protect people and wildlife from pollution, analysis by The Times has found.The breaches of Environment Agency (EA)

tweets.text:
Important investigation by @thetimes shows environmental breaches soar as prosecutions collapse @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/jSX9SK96q8
This issue is picking up pace - and interesting to see who is speaking out https://t.co/VZqhGsI1p6 via @theENDSReport

Our new river site from the air, new habitats establishing & public access track nearly complete. A fantastic community effort at our @EPIC_Sompting project. Cleaner water and inspired community thanks to @HeritageFundL_S  @EnvAgencySE  @SussexGiving @SomptingDowns https://t.co/i6ukX73EzA

I have to say that after all of the years I've been involved in senior management, policy, strategy, comms, I don't think I've ever heard anyone so badly briefed as the chair of the @EnvAgency. 

https://t.co/bWoT0e22jP

Yes good to see some analysis to explain the capacity gap that exists between rising environmental ambitions & the ability to deliver on that. @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency ready to do the job, but we need the means https://t.co/bEZkSXnDPm
Looking forward to the Diglis #FishPass being completed to help the salmon on their way! #FishMigration @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/LVlzeXENcf

tweets.text: After receiving reports from a member of the public, two @EnvAgency field operation officers removed tree branches that were blocking part of the River Blyth in Stannington Vale #Northumberland We appreciate all of the helpful information received from local residents #floodaware https://t.co/ggBQbk6VUa

READ on for how kingfishers, Daubenton‚Äôs bats and grey wagtails are flourishing across London's rivers...

#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek https://t.co/Vy1O8DEZPZ
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency 'We  are rubbish with this much money but we promise not to be quite so bad with loads more of your money', that was my impression.

How come @robertjenrick Planning White Paper has NO detail and asks for NO feedback on the #environmental, #biodiversity and #heritage effects of the plans? If are planned protections are purposefully unclear. @NaturalEngland  @HistoricEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/jSDlzodRaK

tweets.text: #NaturalFloodManagement is a key tool in mitigating the effects of extreme weather. We are working with partners across catchments in the county to #slowtheflow & store water whilst also creating wildlife habitat @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @StaffordshireCC @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/7mvhiUCQjp

a city without reeds is a city without nature's hush-awhile whispers, here by @CodyDock Bromley-by-Bow #LondonRiversWeek2020 @WildLondon @Thames21 @LeeValleyPark @EnvAgencySE @ThamesEstPart @SE_Rivers_Trust @CVP_CraneValley @ColneCAN @LDN_environment @CanalRiverTrust https://t.co/35x3NFA780

This time last year #StormCiara & #StormDennis brought devastating floods to Staffordshire. Today we mark that event with tweets about what we are working on to help mitigate flooding #naturalfloodmanagement #naturebasedsolutions @EnvAgency @theriverstrust @TrentCaba @WildStoke https://t.co/F8Y2Lk1Rgw

@RossCherrington @RSBenwell @Unchecked_UK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency I suspect they don't prioritise it because they have had a VERY clear steer from Defra that it is not a priority. Draw your own conclusions.

Field operations teams are out across the North West today clearing debris screens to reduce flood risk like here at Bessy Brook in Horwich near #Bolton.  

There's lots of rain around this week, keep following us for all the latest flood risk updates. https://t.co/tJSwpdZb4K

@nationaltrust @RSBenwell @_BCT_ @Unchecked_UK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency Yeah seen it all before. U allow trail hunting which is killing the wildlife. Stop sticking your head in the sand & ban trail hunts. If they r not killing wildlife why r there so many videos of them doing it? Why do they need terrier men? Corruption everywhere, police do nothing.

Proud to be a partner and sponsor for this important @EcosystemsNet conference on financing and developing nature-based solutions, and hosting the Investment Readiness Fund panels on behalf of @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK: https://t.co/3WU0Qx8oFJ

tweets.text: @nationaltrust @ChristineHoxwo1 @RSBenwell @_BCT_ @Unchecked_UK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency But not reported to you - because you just ignore it and post this nonsense (and irrelevant) rubbish in response.

@ChristineHoxwo1 @RSBenwell @_BCT_ @Unchecked_UK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @nationaltrust The @nationaltrust aids and abets the the killing of foxes and their cubs, and no doubt, birds, other animals and most definitely stags, too. #NationalMistrust

@ChristineHoxwo1 @RSBenwell @_BCT_ @Unchecked_UK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ChristineHoxwo1 Hello Christine, we don't allow illegal activity on our land, and if there is clear evidence of illegal activity, this should be reported to the police. Find out more here: https://t.co/QUQVBEa1ej
@RSBenwell @_BCT_ @Unchecked_UK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @Nationaltrust allows Trail hunts on their land. Please don't donate to them. Trail hunts kill foxes and other wildlife animals.

tweets.text: The Norfolk/Suffolk coastline is the fastest eroding in Western Europe. Karen Thomas from @CPE_NandS spoke at #FloodandCoast2020 about the importance of successful community engagement and what's required to achieve the @EnvAgency‚Äôs coastal strategy. @ASN_Media #coastaladaptation https://t.co/TjcFzKFQbF
Out in #Warwick, #Leamington & #Rugby today clearing trash screens and checking hotspot areas following last weekends rain @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/atLJkOTSNT

We are working in multiple catchments delivering #naturebasedsolutions through #naturalfloodmanagement. We work with landowners to create storage pools, wetlands & leaky dams which all help to #slowtheflow of water as well as clean it & provide wonderful habitat @EnvAgency https://t.co/7PkzJBXb2A

This is a valuable step in supporting NHS Test and Trace.

tweets.text: Look who was found in the #Thames recently! Historically a common sight, the migratory Twaite shad is now rare and it was great to see it near Blackfriars in Central London! #WorldFishMigrationDay #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek #TidewayLondon https://t.co/MjBH1APVkg

@RSBenwell @Unchecked_UK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency Nether Natural England Nor EA prioritise enforcement, and would rather play at fluffy stuff rather than actually protecting habitats, watercourses and wildlife

#DidYouKnow rainfall can wash dog poo into bathing waters through the surface water drains and streams, even if you're far from the beach?
 
Make sure you bag up your dog's poo and put it in the bin.

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/gnpjBUl8jX
